page.title: 18SHAFTON BUS DEPOT
page.content: The{Yorkshire Traction Bus Depot}is a big brick and steel shed where many buses are{cleaned, serviced}and {refuelled}before going out.{Light {repairs}are done here but{heavy {repairs}are done at{Barnsley. Buses {are washed}in a version of a carwash where the bus goes between 2 large rollers and water is sprayed over it; another roller cleans the roof. In the Depot are{offices}and a{cafe}for the workers to eat in. You can go almost anywhere by{bus;}in South Yorkshire single tickets cost{2p}for{children {and 10p}for{adults.}The buses run to Barnsley, Pontefract,{Wakefield}and Royston; they are{red}in colour and are{double}and{single deckers;}one bus for{learner}drivers and is{red, white and{blue. All}the buses are made by {Leyland.}Many{people}who live in {Shafton}work there.
